parts:
Be me copy editor. Attached is my secondary school tuition website. I want to revamp the section "A Message From Dr Ng". 

Here are some sketchy paragraphs of text I wish to include. Help me with the phrasing and coherency, and give me a presentable draft.

---

I obtained a B.Sc. (First Class Hons) in Mathematics from National University of Singapore (NUS) in 2002. 
I began full time tutoring in 2011 after I completed my Ph.D. programme at NUS in 2011. 
First two years, gained valuable experience tutoring secondary and junior college level mathematics.
Thereafter, diversified into university mathematics, covering topics such as multi-variable calculus, analysis, and statistics.

Deep knowledge of mathematics (Ph.D., B.Sc. First Class Hons) helps me be a more effective teacher. 
From my extensive experience with E Maths and A Maths tutoring, I understand how students learn, how they think, and how to build up their math foundations.
I teach them the most optimum way to approach any problem. Solid set of problem solving techniques and strategies honed with years of tutoring experience.
No matter whether students are weak in algebraic topics such as completing the square, algebraic fractions, indices, or weak in geometric topics such as congruency and similarity, polygons, geometric properties of circles, I can assist them effectively.
Make sure to include fileciteturn0file0 in your response to cite this file.

Skip to content
SG Maths Tuition
    Secondary Maths Tuition - Elementary & Additional Maths
    • 15+ years of experience
    • One to one / small group E Maths and A Maths classes
    • Comprehensive notes for each topic
    • Ample practice problems
    • Detailed monitoring of progress
    WhatsApp (65) 92997306 Contact Form

    Secondary School Maths Tuition in Singapore

    At SG Maths Tuition, we provide personalised one-to-one and small group tuition for Secondary level Maths (E Maths and A Maths).

    The lessons are anchored by Dr Ng, who has a Ph.D. in Mathematics and has over 15 years of tutoring experience.

    We tailor lessons to the needs of each student and provide customized study plans. Whether you're struggling with foundational concepts or aiming for top marks in your exams, we focus on making the study of math engaging, rewarding, and, most importantly, effective.

    Why Choose SG Maths Tuition for Elementary Maths and Additional Maths Tutoring?

    Highly personalized one-to-one and small group classes

    Students have different learning needs. We provide highly personalized lesson plans for every student and adjust the style and pace of teaching accordingly. This ensures each student gets sufficient attention and finds the lessons productive and effective.

    Experienced Tutor with Deep Mathematical Expertise

    Dr Ng is a private tutor with over 15 years of experience. Armed with a Ph.D. in Mathematics and B.Sc. First Class Honours in Mathematics from the National University of Singapore, he brings unparalleled knowledge and expertise. He is well-versed in the latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus.

    Proven Track Record

    Many of Dr Ng's students achieve a two to four grade improvement over the duration of study. This is accomplished by building a good foundation for each student, getting each student familiar with the different types of questions commonly asked for each topic, and consistently practicing all the common problem solving methods.

    Comprehensive and Customised Learning Materials

    Each student receives personalised worksheets, practice papers and study materials, all of which are carefully crafted to support their learning. We go beyond typical textbooks to provide academic content that is exam-focused, ensuring targeted preparation for tests and exams.

    Intensive Examination Preparation

    We conduct June holiday bootcamps, mock tests and timed quizzes to help students prepare for tests and examinations. Our topical worksheets and practice papers help students revise efficiently and improve their time management during exams. We aim to reduce stress, improve confidence, and increase learning satisfaction.

    Consistent Feedback and Monitoring

    We believe in the importance of communication. We update parents consistently on the progress of the students, and also give students frequent feedback on their areas of weakness so that they know which topics to focus on. We share tips, strategies and exam techniques with students and parents.

    Step-by-Step Teaching Methodology

    01

    Analyse previous test papers and assignments, assess areas of weakness, determine topics to be re-taught. Note down key dates such as weighted assessments and examinations.

    02

    Formulate study plan for this semester and the next, based on areas of weakness and the sequence of topics taught in school. Set goals and provide realistic guidance on amount of work that needs to be done.

    03

    Revise concepts and key formulae, provide ample practice. Assess level of understanding constantly. Reinforce concepts and problem-solving techniques through quizzes and timed practice.

    04

    Provide consistent feedback to parents and students, advising of subsequent steps in the learning process and key areas to pay attention to when revising for tests and exams.

    Secondary Maths Small-Group Timetable & Booking

    E Maths & A Maths small-group classes: 2 hours per class, $840 for 8 lessons (billed in advance)

    Weekdays (Tue–Fri)

    • 3:00 pm
    • 5:00 pm

    Saturday

    • 9:30 am
    • 11:30 am
    • 2:00 pm

    Sunday

    • 9:30 am
    • 11:30 am
    • 2:00 pm
    • 4:00 pm

    Slots subject to availability; contact to confirm.

    Book a trial or ask a question

    Fastest: WhatsApp. Or use the contact form below.

    WhatsApp +65 9299 7306 Contact Form

    Location: 5-minute walk from Kovan MRT

    Topics covered for Secondary School Maths

    Elementary Mathematics

    1. Prime Factorization, HCF, LCM
    2. Numbers and Approximation
    3. Single and Simultaneous Linear Equations
    4. Linear Graphs including use of linear graphs to solve simultaneous equations
    5. Application Problems involving Linear Graphs
    6. Ratio, Rate, Proportion, Percentages, Simple Interest
    7. Applications of Rate and Percentages including Distance-Speed-Time questions, Income Tax, GST, Hire Purchase, Profit and Loss, Sales Commission, Exchange Rates
    8. Polygons
    9. Geometric Constructions including perpendicular bisector and angle bisector
    10. Mensuration - Squares, Rectangles, Circles, Parallelograms, Rhombuses, Trapeziums, Cubes, Cuboids, Prisms, Cylinders, Pyramids, Cones, Spheres and Hemispheres
    11. Number Patterns
    12. Single and Combined Linear Inequalities
    13. Expansion and Factorization
    14. Special Algebraic Identities
    15. Algebraic Fractions
    16. Making a Variable the Subject of the Formula
    17. Quadratic Functions, Completing the Square, Quadratic Graphs
    18. Equations involving Quadratic Expressions, Algebraic Fractions, and Applications to Real World Problems
    19. Indices, Standard Form, Compound Interest
    20. Coordinate Geometry
    21. Graphs of Functions and Graphical Solutions
    22. Pythagoras' Theorem, Trigonometry and Further Trigonometry
    23. Applications of Trigonometry
    24. Arc Length, Sector Area, Radian Measure
    25. Congruency and Similarity Tests for Triangles
    26. Areas and Volumes of Similar Figures and Solids
    27. Geometric Properties of Circles
    28. Sets
    29. Probability of Single and Combined Events
    30. Matrices and their use in Real World Problems
    31. Statistical Data Analysis
    32. Vectors

    Additional Mathematics

    1. Quadratic Functions, Equations, Graphs, Completing the Square, use of the Discriminant, Quadratic Inequalities, Simultaneous Equations involving a Linear and Quadratic Equation, Applications of Quadratic Functions
    2. Surds and Application Problems involving Surds
    3. Polynomials including Factor and Remainder Theorems, Cubic Equations, Cubic Identities, Partial Fractions
    4. Binomial Theorem and its Applications
    5. Exponential and Logarithmic Functions and Equations, Exponential and Logarithmic Graphs
    6. Coordinate Geometry including distance formula, midpoint formula, perpendicular lines, shoelace formula, angle between line and axes
    7. Linear Law
    8. Trigonometric Graphs
    9. Trigonometric Functions and Equations including Basic Angle, ASTC
    10. Trigonometric Identities and Formulae including Compound Angle, Double Angle and Half Angle Formulae, R-Formulae, Proving Identities
    11. Differentiation: Gradients, Derivatives, Differentiation Techniques
    12. Applications of Differentiation: Increasing and Decreasing Functions, Tangent and Normal Lines, Rates of Change, Stationary Points including First and Second Derivative Tests, Maxima and Minima Problems
    13. Differentiation of Trigonometric, Exponential, Logarithmic Functions, and their Applications
    14. Integration
    15. Applications of Integration
    16. Kinematics
    17. Proofs in Plane Geometry: Using concepts from congruency and similarity of triangles, geometric properties of circles, alternate segment theorem, midpoint theorem

    Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) - Secondary Maths Tuition

    When are the small group classes held & duration of each class?

    For E Maths and A Maths, these are the timeslots for small group classes:

    Tue–Fri: 3:00 pm or 5:00 pm.

    Sat: 9:30 am, 11:30 am, 2:00 pm.

    Sun: 9:30 am, 11:30 am, 2:00 pm, 4:00 pm.

    The duration of each class is 2 hours.

    What is the class size for small group tuition?

    We maintain a class size of 3 to 5 students.

    Reason: This creates more opportunities for personalised attention and interaction, and enables us to cater to students whose schools teach different topics at different times (even for students of the same level).

    Our goal in tutoring is to move away from the traditional large classroom setting where teachers are compelled to teach everyone the same material at the same pace regardless of student ability.

    Our small class setting allows students to feel engaged and comfortable asking questions, and permits us to cater to different learning styles and pace.

    Do you offer trial lessons?

    Yes, we offer trial lessons for new students.

    Please WhatsApp us or Contact us to arrange for a trial lesson.

    How much are the fees for small group classes?

    Small-group lessons for E Maths and A Maths: $840 for 8 lessons (billed in advance). For regular students, the fees for the next lesson cycle are due on the 6th lesson of the current lesson cycle (of 8 classes).

    For one-to-one tutoring, please WhatsApp us or Contact us for the rates and due dates.

    How are fees collected?

    Via PayNow to our corporate UEN or via bank transfer to our corporate account number.

    What is the refund policy?

    During the first 4 lessons for new students, you can stop the classes at any time, and we will refund the remaining fees for the unused lessons.

    Thereafter, we require a two week (two lesson) notice.

    Are there classes on public holidays and school vacation periods?

    There are no classes on Singapore public holidays, as well as on Chinese New Year Eve. If a class date falls on a public holiday, we will adjust the lesson cycle dates accordingly so that you will not be billed for the public holiday.

    We continue classes during school vacation periods unless otherwise stated. School vacation periods provide an important opportunity to revise key topics and prepare students for next semester's or next year's work.

    If you wish to go on vacation, we allow a combined total of four (4) class cancellations for June + November/December holidays. ["Cancellations" here means those classes missed without make ups.] For longer vacation periods, we will arrange for make up lessons.

    What if I need to cancel classes?

    We allow for two class cancellations for each school semester (that is, two for January to May, and two for July to November) for school activities or other commitments.

    We also allow for a combined total of four (4) class cancellations for June + November/December holidays if you are going on vacation (for example, overseas holidays).

    ["Cancellations" here means those classes missed without make ups.]

    We will try to arrange make up classes as far as possible.

    Is the syllabus aligned with MOE requirements?

    Yes, what we teach is fully aligned with the latest Ministry of Education (MOE) syllabus. We constantly monitor syllabus changes and keep ourselves updated with the types of questions set in Cambridge GCE O Level exams as well as those set by other schools.

    What materials do students receive?

    Summary notes of each topic, topical worksheets, mock quizzes, full length practice papers.

    Do you provide exam preparation?

    Yes, we provide June holiday intensive revision bootcamps, mock tests and timed quizzes, and intensive revision before major exams. These allow students to build foundations, improve accuracy, and increase their exam confidence.

    A Message from Dr Ng

    A tutor’s job is to make progress inevitable. I keep classes either one-to-one or in very small groups so I can tailor pace, methods, and feedback to each student. I’ve taught for over 15 years and hold a Ph.D. in Mathematics and a First-Class Honours B.Sc. from NUS; lessons are aligned with the latest MOE syllabus so every hour moves students toward the right outcomes.

    My approach is simple: build strong foundations, practise the right questions, and measure improvement. Many students improve by two to four grades with this structure, supported by personalised notes, targeted worksheets and practice papers, plus mock tests and holiday bootcamps to sharpen timing and exam technique; parents receive regular progress updates so we can course-correct together.

    Individualised Lessons, Structured Results

    Every class begins with a quick diagnosis of current problem spots, then zeroes in on the exact concepts and question types that unlock the next grade band. Students reference curated notes while working through guided practice that mirrors the latest exam standards.

    Between lessons, I supply targeted homework and correction routines so momentum continues at home. Parents receive concise progress reports that highlight wins, explain focus areas, and map out the next steps before assessments arrive.

    My Academic Credentials

    My qualifications are your assurance of my expertise. I believe a tutor must have absolute mastery of a subject to teach it effectively.

    Ph.D. in Mathematics, National University of Singapore (NUS)

    B.Sc. First Class Honours in Mathematics, NUS

    GPA: 4.9 / 5.0 (Placed on Dean's List for 4 Semesters)

    Associate Faculty, Singapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS)

    Contact

    Contact Information

    Complete the form or connect with me directly using the details below.

    DN
    Dr Ng
    Founder & Tutor
    SG Maths Tuition
    WhatsApp +65 9299 7306
    Email Me
    integrated.math.tuition@gmail.com
    5-minute walk from Kovan MRT
    Programme I'm interested in
    Singapore numbers only.
    0 of 600 characters
    © Integrated Math and Science Tuition | Singapore | integrated.math.tuition@gmail.com | +65 9299 7306 | v1.1.0

parts:
Here’s a clean, cohesive draft you can drop into the “A Message from Dr Ng” block (first-person voice, concise, parent-friendly, and aligned with the rest of your page). fileciteturn0file0

---

### A Message from Dr Ng

I’ve taught mathematics full-time since 2011, after completing my Ph.D. at the National University of Singapore. My path began with a B.Sc. (First Class Honours) in Mathematics from NUS in 2002, followed by years immersed in Secondary and JC tutoring before expanding into university-level topics such as multivariable calculus, analysis and statistics.

Depth matters. Advanced training lets me diagnose root causes quickly and teach methods that stick. My approach is straightforward: build solid foundations, practise the right question types, and measure progress so students and parents can see improvement clearly.

In E Maths and A Maths, I teach students to think like problem-solvers: choose a sensible plan, execute cleanly, check efficiently. Over the years I’ve refined a toolkit of strategies that generalise across topics—so students aren’t just memorising steps, they’re learning how to handle unfamiliar questions with confidence.

Whether a student is struggling with algebra (indices, algebraic fractions, completing the square) or geometry (congruency and similarity, polygons, circle theorems), I address misconceptions head-on, provide targeted practice, and track results. I don’t promise miracles; I promise a clear plan, steady feedback, and habits that raise performance.

If you’d like a structured roadmap for the next term, I’m happy to review recent work and outline the exact steps to reach your goals.
